title: Market and Perception Research Instruction Letter (IMIC-S520-06) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No IMIC-S520-06-V02 Effective Date 02-05-2012 Update Date 12-06-2024 Related Unit / Owner MIC / Pazarlama ve Kurumsal İletişim Direktörlüğü Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim The aim of this document is to establish the rules regarding perception and market research to be conducted within the framework of marketing activities. Scope This document covers the MIC-Marketing Unit and the Sabancı University unit related to the research topic. All types of (qualitative and quantitative) market, perception, expectation, and satisfaction research conducted in line with the corporate marketing objectives of Sabancı University or its departments are within the scope of this document. Principle Market, perception, expectation, and satisfaction research conducted in line with marketing objectives is conducted through a subcontractor or by the MIC itself, in accordance with international standards. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations MIC: Marketing and Institutional Communications Directorate Regulations 1. The topics of the research to be conducted in line with Sabancı University's marketing objectives are determined within the framework of the annual marketing plans and included in the budget plan. The marketing plan also includes a timeline for conducting the research and its delivery date. 2. MIC prepares a draft brief to clearly define the needs related to the research with the determined topic. 3. The brief prepared by MIC is detailed in a collaborative effort between the research unit and MIC, and the text is finalized. 4. This brief includes the research's: a. Subject, b. Scope, c. Objectives, d. Target audience. 5. The prepared brief is forwarded to several research companies specialized in the field for proposals. MIC determines the number of research companies to submit proposals based on the research's topic and scope. 6. The brief is forwarded to the research companies. Meetings are held if necessary. 7. Research companies submit their research proposals to MIC. These proposals must include the following elements: a. Research topic, b. Target audiences c. Sample d. Research Method e. Geographical region where it will be conducted f. Modules g. Project steps and timeline h. Budget. 8. The MIC evaluates the incoming proposals (if necessary, evaluates the proposals with the relevant unit) and selects the most suitable candidate. 9. The MIC closely monitors each stage of the research, requests and evaluates interim results from the company. It checks the schedule and budget. 10. The research results are submitted to the MIC in written reports. The MIC may request the research company to make an oral presentation and provide detailed analyses of all or part of the research. 11. The research results are evaluated considering the research objective and overall marketing objectives, and the MIC presents action recommendations to senior management and/or the relevant unit. 12. The action recommendations are then detailed and incorporated into new communication and marketing plans. These plans are also implemented, measured, and evaluated. 13. Research reports are archived in MIC files and/or electronic archives. 14. The frequency at which the research will be repeated is determined during the evaluation phase.
